comments.body:
This is a new install of Titanium Studio.

Many people report this same issue on a myriad of sites but I have found no posted solution.

It is extremely dissapointing that a Titanium install cannot run a sample program. I would understand if this was a new bug, however it appears to have been around in one form or another for a couple of years. It seems like the installer does not install a working set of compatible libraries.

I have tried for days to find an answer to this problem. The promise and approach of this platfom is why I have invested time in a cross platform solution. I hope you support your current and potential user community enough to take a new user's concerns seriously.
Can you send me the diagnostic logs (Help > Studio > View diagnostic logs) to investigate further ?

Dear guys,

I have uploaded and installed the last revision of Titanium SDK yesterday (October 19th)
Is there a way to bypass this bug by downgraded the Titanium SDK and/or the Android SDK ?
Could you confirm that this bug will be also impacted when trying to run from a real Android Device ?

Note: still running under Windows XP SP3.

Regards,

PIJACK
